p: Several infectious agents, parasites, bacteria, and viruses can provoke myalgia, acute myositis, chronic myositis, or rhabdomyolysis [ 9, 10, 11]. Among them, viral infections mainly associated with muscle failure are: influenza virus, HIV, HTLV-1, hepatitis viruses (B and C), coronavirus, enteroviruses, adenoviruses, cytomegalovirus, Epsteinâ€“Barr virus, Torque teno virus, parvovirus B19, and arboviruses, especially, among these latter, those belonging to Togaviridae and Flaviviridae families [ 8].
